intro: Tristaniopsis oreophila, commonly known as the mountain tristaniopsis, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the montane rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often on rocky or humus-rich soils. Its botanical features include lanceolate leaves with prominent veins and a short, woody stem. Due to habitat loss, Tristaniopsis oreophila is considered vulnerable, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
